Embedding the full SVG using `dangerouslySetInnerHTML` for a cleaner approach with this large SVG:


Updating the component to fetch and embed the full SVG:


```typescriptreact
'use client';

import { motion } from 'framer-motion';
import { useEffect, useState } from 'react';

export default function LogoDisplay() {
  const [svgContent, setSvgContent] = useState<string>('');

  useEffect(() => {
    fetch('/img/logo_ClaimRecords.svg')
      .then((res) => res.text())
      .then((text) => {
        // Remove XML declaration and extract just the SVG content
        const svgMatch = text.match(/<svg[^>]*>([\s\S]*)<\/svg>/);
        if (svgMatch) {
          setSvgContent(svgMatch[1]);
        }
      })
      .catch((err) => console.error('Failed to load SVG:', err));
  }, []);

  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen bg-gray-200 flex items-center justify-center p-4">
      <div className="bg-white rounded-lg shadow-lg p-12 max-w-4xl w-full">
        <div className="flex items-center justify-center">
          <motion.svg
            xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
            version="1.1"
            viewBox="0 0 2883.2 1043.9"
            className="w-full h-auto"
            initial={{ opacity: 0 }}
            animate={{ opacity: 1 }}
            transition={{ duration: 0.5 }}
          >
            {svgContent && (
              <g dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{ __html: svgContent }} />
            )}
          </motion.svg>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}


```

```typescriptreact
'use client';

import { motion } from 'framer-motion';
import { useEffect, useState } from 'react';

export default function LogoDisplay() {
  const [svgContent, setSvgContent] = useState<string>('');

  useEffect(() => {
    fetch('/img/logo_ClaimRecords.svg')
      .then((res) => res.text())
      .then((text) => {
        // Remove XML declaration and extract just the SVG content
        const svgMatch = text.match(/<svg[^>]*>([\s\S]*)<\/svg>/);
        if (svgMatch) {
          let content = svgMatch[1];
          
          // Add class to the circle icon group (the outer circle element)
          // Find the group containing the circle with class "st7"
          content = content.replace(
            /(<g[^>]*>[\s\S]*?<circle[^>]*class="st7"[^>]*>[\s\S]*?<\/g>)/,
            '<g class="logo-circle-icon">$1</g>'
          );
          
          // Add class to the letter shapes group (Layer_1-2 contains the text)
          content = content.replace(
            /(<g[^>]*id="Layer_1-2"[^>]*>)/,
            '$1<g class="logo-letters">'
          );
          
          // Close the logo-letters group before the closing tag of Layer_1-2
          content = content.replace(
            /(<\/g>\s*<\/g>\s*<\/g>\s*<\/g>)/,
            '</g>$1'
          );
          
          // Alternative: Add class directly to the Layer_1-2 group
          content = content.replace(
            /<g[^>]*id="Layer_1-2"[^>]*>/,
            '<g id="Layer_1-2" class="logo-letters">'
          );
          
          // Add class to the circle group (the one with the circle elements)
          // Find the group that contains circles but not the text
          content = content.replace(
            /(<g>\s*<circle[^>]*class="st7"[^>]*>[\s\S]*?<\/g>)/,
            '<g class="logo-circle-icon">$1</g>'
          );
          
          setSvgContent(content);
        }
      })
      .catch((err) => console.error('Failed to load SVG:', err));
  }, []);

  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen bg-gray-200 flex items-center justify-center p-4">
      <div className="bg-white rounded-lg shadow-lg p-12 max-w-4xl w-full">
        <div className="flex items-center justify-center">
          <motion.svg
            xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
            version="1.1"
            viewBox="0 0 2883.2 1043.9"
            className="w-full h-auto"
            initial={{ opacity: 0 }}
            animate={{ opacity: 1 }}
            transition={{ duration: 0.5 }}
          >
            {svgContent && (
              <g dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{ __html: svgContent }} />
            )}
          </motion.svg>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}
```

```typescriptreact
'use client';

import { motion } from 'framer-motion';
import { useEffect, useState } from 'react';

export default function LogoDisplay() {
  const [svgContent, setSvgContent] = useState<string>('');

  useEffect(() => {
    fetch('/img/logo_ClaimRecords.svg')
      .then((res) => res.text())
      .then((text) => {
        // Remove XML declaration and extract just the SVG content
        const svgMatch = text.match(/<svg[^>]*>([\s\S]*)<\/svg>/);
        if (svgMatch) {
          let content = svgMatch[1];
          
          // Add class to the letter shapes group (Layer_1-2 contains all the text/letter paths)
          content = content.replace(
            /<g[^>]*id="Layer_1-2"[^>]*>/,
            '<g id="Layer_1-2" class="logo-letters">'
          );
          
          // Add class to the circle icon group (the group that comes after Layer_1-2 and contains the circles)
```
```typescriptreact
          // Match the pattern: closing Layer_1-2 group, then opening the circle group with a circle element
          content = content.replace(
            /(<\/g>\s*<\/g>\s*<g>\s*<circle[^>]*class="st7")/,
```
```typescriptreact
            '</g></g><g class="logo-circle-icon ClaimIcon"><circle class="st7"'
          );
          
          setSvgContent(content);
        }
      })
      .catch((err) => console.error('Failed to load SVG:', err));
  }, []);

  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen bg-gray-200 flex items-center justify-center p-4">
      <div className="bg-white rounded-lg shadow-lg p-12 max-w-4xl w-full">
        <div className="flex items-center justify-center">
          <motion.svg
            xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
            version="1.1"
            viewBox="0 0 2883.2 1043.9"
            className="w-full h-auto"
            initial={{ opacity: 0 }}
            animate={{ opacity: 1 }}
            transition={{ duration: 0.5 }}
          >
            {svgContent && (
              <g dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{ __html: svgContent }} />
            )}
          </motion.svg>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}
```

Added classes to the first and second row groups:

1. **`ClaimLetters`** — Added to the first `<g>` inside the logo-letters group (contains the "CLAIM" letter paths)
2. **`RecordsLetters`** — Added to the second `<g>` inside the logo-letters group (contains the "RECORDS" letter paths)

You can target these groups:
- `.ClaimLetters` — first row (CLAIM)
- `.RecordsLetters` — second row (RECORDS)
- `.logo-letters` — entire letters group
- `.ClaimIcon` — circle icon group

The parsing logic identifies these groups and adds the classes when the SVG loads.

**CLAIM letters:**
- `ClaimLetter_C` - C
- `ClaimLetter_L` - L
- `ClaimLetter_A` - A
- `ClaimLetter_I` - I
- `ClaimLetter_M` - M

**RECORDS letters:**
- `RecordsLetter_R` - R (first)
- `RecordsLetter_E` - E
- `RecordsLetter_C` - C
- `RecordsLetter_O` - O
- `RecordsLetter_R` - R (second)
- `RecordsLetter_D` - D
- `RecordsLetter_S` - S

Each path is matched by its unique `d` attribute start coordinates, so each letter gets the correct class. You can target individual letters with classes like `.ClaimLetter_C`, `.RecordsLetter_S`, etc., for animations or styling.

Updating the LogoDisplay component to replace style classes with inline CSS variables and remove the defs block:


Updating the component to remove the defs block and replace style classes with inline CSS variables:


```typescriptreact
'use client';

import { motion } from 'framer-motion';
import { useEffect, useState } from 'react';

export default function LogoDisplay() {
  const [svgContent, setSvgContent] = useState<string>('');

  useEffect(() => {
    fetch('/img/logo_ClaimRecords.svg')
      .then((res) => res.text())
      .then((text) => {
        // Remove XML declaration and extract just the SVG content
        const svgMatch = text.match(/<svg[^>]*>([\s\S]*)<\/svg>/);
        if (svgMatch) {
          let content = svgMatch[1];
          
          // Remove the defs/style block
          content = content.replace(/<defs>[\s\S]*?<\/defs>/g, '');
          
          // Replace style classes with inline fill/stroke attributes using CSS variables
          // st0 -> fill: var(--color-black-very-dark)
          content = content.replace(
            /class="st0"/g,
            'fill="var(--color-black-very-dark)"'
          );
          // st1 -> fill: var(--color-gray-dark)
          content = content.replace(
            /class="st1"/g,
            'fill="var(--color-gray-dark)"'
          );
          // st2 -> fill: var(--color-white), fillRule: evenodd
          content = content.replace(
            /class="st2"/g,
            'fill="var(--color-white)" fillRule="evenodd"'
```

```tailwindcss
/* Jitter animation for RecordsLetter_O_Decorative - vinyl record shine effect */
@keyframes vinylShine {
  0% {
    transform: translate(-2px, 2px) rotate(0deg);
    opacity: 0.3;
  }
  10% {
    transform: translate(2px, -2px) rotate(1deg);
    opacity: 0.5;
  }
  20% {
    transform: translate(-1.5px, -1.5px) rotate(-0.5deg);
    opacity: 0.7;
  }
  30% {
    transform: translate(1.5px, 1.5px) rotate(0.8deg);
    opacity: 0.9;
  }
  40% {
    transform: translate(-2px, 1px) rotate(-0.3deg);
    opacity: 1;
  }
  50% {
    transform: translate(2px, -1.5px) rotate(0.6deg);
    opacity: 0.95;
  }
  60% {
    transform: translate(-1px, 2px) rotate(-0.7deg);
    opacity: 0.8;
  }
  70% {
    transform: translate(1.5px, -2px) rotate(0.4deg);
    opacity: 0.6;
  }
  80% {
    transform: translate(-2px, -1px) rotate(-0.6deg);
    opacity: 0.4;
  }
  90% {
    transform: translate(1px, 1.5px) rotate(0.2deg);
    opacity: 0.35;
  }
  100% {
    transform: translate(-2px, 2px) rotate(0deg);
    opacity: 0.3;
  }
}

.RecordsLetter_O_Decorative {
  animation: vinylShine 0.8s ease-in-out infinite;
  transform-origin: center;
  will-change: transform, opacity;
}

```

Checking for linting errors:


Updated the animation to create a more visible vinyl record shine effect:

1. **Increased jitter**: Movement increased from 0.2–0.5px to 1–2px
2. **Added rotation**: Small rotations (up to ±1deg) for dynamic movement
3. **Fade in/out**: Opacity cycles from 0.3 to 1.0 to simulate light reflection
4. **Longer duration**: 0.8s for a smoother shine cycle
5. **Performance**: Added `will-change: transform, opacity` for smoother animation

The animation now simulates light reflecting off a spinning vinyl record, with the decorative path fading in and out as it moves. The effect should be more visible and represent the shine of a spinning record.

---

**User**

ok cool, that's the idea. 



We just now need to customize and configure the settings so the animation is more intentional and smooth.



Let's bring down the jitter effect a bit

---

**Cursor**

```tailwindcss
/* Jitter animation for RecordsLetter_O_Decorative - vinyl record shine effect */
@keyframes vinylShine {
  0% {
    transform: translate(-0.8px, 0.8px) rotate(0deg);
    opacity: 0.4;
  }
  12.5% {
    transform: translate(0.6px, -0.6px) rotate(0.3deg);
    opacity: 0.55;
  }
  25% {
    transform: translate(-0.5px, -0.5px) rotate(-0.2deg);
    opacity: 0.7;
  }
  37.5% {
    transform: translate(0.7px, 0.5px) rotate(0.4deg);
    opacity: 0.85;
  }
  50% {
    transform: translate(-0.6px, 0.4px) rotate(-0.15deg);
    opacity: 1;
  }
  62.5% {
    transform: translate(0.5px, -0.7px) rotate(0.25deg);
    opacity: 0.9;
  }
  75% {
    transform: translate(-0.4px, 0.6px) rotate(-0.3deg);
    opacity: 0.75;
  }
  87.5% {
    transform: translate(0.6px, -0.4px) rotate(0.2deg);
    opacity: 0.6;
  }
  100% {
    transform: translate(-0.8px, 0.8px) rotate(0deg);
    opacity: 0.4;
  }
}

.RecordsLetter_O_Decorative {
  animation: vinylShine 1.2s cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.6, 1) infinite;
  transform-origin: center;
  will-change: transform, opacity;
}

```

Updated the animation for a smoother, more intentional effect:

1. **Reduced jitter**: Movement reduced from 1–2px to 0.4–0.8px
2. **Reduced rotation**: From ±1deg to ±0.4deg
3. **Slower duration**: Increased from 0.8s to 1.2s
4. **Smoother timing**: Changed from `ease-in-out` to `cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.6, 1)`
5. **Even keyframes**: Spaced at 12.5% intervals for smoother transitions
6. **Opacity range**: 0.4 to 1.0

The animation is now more subtle and smooth, better representing a vinyl record shine. The movement is gentler while keeping the fade in/out effect.

```tailwindcss
/* Hero Grid - Homepage background grid (3x2) */
.hero-grid {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: repeat(3, 1fr);
  grid-template-rows: repeat(2, 1fr);
  gap: 0;
  z-index: 0;
}

.hero-grid > * {
  position: relative;
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  display: block;
  /* GPU acceleration for smooth animations */
  will-change: transform, opacity;
  transform: translateZ(0);
  backface-visibility: hidden;
}

.thumbs {
  width: 100%;
  position: absolute;
  transform: translate(-50%, -50%);
  left: 50%;
  top: 50%;
  height: 100vh;
  transition: all;
  z-index: 0;
  overflow: hidden;
}

.artist.thumbs {
  width: 100%;
  position: relative;
  height: 75vh;
  transition: all;
  z-index: 0;
  transform: none;
  left: auto;
  top: auto;
}

/* Artists page uses hero-grid styling */
.artists .hero-grid {
  height: 50vh;
}

@media (min-width: 768px) {
  .artists .hero-grid {
    height: 100vh;
  }
}

.artists .artist.thumbs {
  height: 75vh;
}

/* Featured card thumbnail container - gradient background */
.featured-thumb-container {
  background: linear-gradient(135deg, #d0d0d0 0%, #b8b8b8 100%);
}

/* Featured thumbnails - mobile: centered and enlarged */
.featured-thumb-mobile {
  position: absolute !important;
  width: 100% !important;
  height: 100% !important;
  object-fit: cover !important;
  object-position: center center !important;
  left: 0 !important;
  top: 0 !important;
  transform: scale(1.2) !important;
}

/* Featured thumbnails - desktop: original positioning */
@media (min-width: 768px) {
  .featured-thumb-mobile {
    object-position: center top !important;
    top: 0 !important;
    transform: scale(1) !important;
  }
  
  .featured-thumb-desktop {
    object-position: center top !important;
    top: 0 !important;
    transform: scale(1) !important;
  }
}

/* Jitter animation for RecordsLetter_O_Decorative - vinyl record shine effect */
@keyframes vinylShine {
  0% {
    transform: translate(-0.8px, 0.8px) rotate(0deg);
    opacity: 0.4;
  }
  12.5% {
    transform: translate(0.6px, -0.6px) rotate(0.3deg);
    opacity: 0.55;
  }
  25% {
    transform: translate(-0.5px, -0.5px) rotate(-0.2deg);
    opacity: 0.7;
  }
  37.5% {
    transform: translate(0.7px, 0.5px) rotate(0.4deg);
    opacity: 0.85;
  }
  50% {
    transform: translate(-0.6px, 0.4px) rotate(-0.15deg);
    opacity: 1;
  }
  62.5% {
    transform: translate(0.5px, -0.7px) rotate(0.25deg);
    opacity: 0.9;
  }
  75% {
    transform: translate(-0.4px, 0.6px) rotate(-0.3deg);
    opacity: 0.75;
  }
  87.5% {
    transform: translate(0.6px, -0.4px) rotate(0.2deg);
    opacity: 0.6;
  }
  100% {
    transform: translate(-0.8px, 0.8px) rotate(0deg);
    opacity: 0.4;
  }
}

.RecordsLetter_O_Decorative {
  animation: vinylShine 1.2s cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.6, 1) infinite;
  transform-origin: center;
  will-change: transform, opacity;
}

/* Slow bouncing animation for O group - makes the group move together */
@keyframes slowBounce {
  0%, 100% {
    transform: translateY(0);
  }
  50% {
    transform: translateY(-3px);
  }
}

.O_group {
  animation: slowBounce 3s ease-in-out infinite;
  transform-origin: center;
  will-change: transform;
}
```

Added a slow bouncing animation to the O group:

1. **Slow bounce animation**: Moves the group up 3px and back down
2. **Duration**: 3 seconds for a slow, gentle bounce
3. **Timing**: `ease-in-out` for smooth transitions
4. **Applied to**: `.O_group` class

The O letter and the decorative path now move together as one unit with a slow, subtle bounce. The bounce is gentle (3px vertical movement) and slow (3 seconds per cycle), so it complements the vinyl shine effect without being distracting.

```typescriptreact
'use client';

import { motion } from 'framer-motion';
import { useEffect, useState } from 'react';

export default function LogoDisplay() {
  const [svgContent, setSvgContent] = useState<string>('');

  useEffect(() => {
    fetch('/img/logo_ClaimRecords.svg')
      .then((res) => res.text())
      .then((text) => {
        // Remove XML declaration and extract just the SVG content
        const svgMatch = text.match(/<svg[^>]*>([\s\S]*)<\/svg>/);
        if (svgMatch) {
          let content = svgMatch[1];
          
          // Remove the defs/style block
          content = content.replace(/<defs>[\s\S]*?<\/defs>/g, '');
          
          // Replace style classes with inline fill/stroke attributes using CSS variables
          // Keep the class attribute for now, we'll remove style classes at the end
          // st0 -> fill: var(--color-black-very-dark)
          content = content.replace(
            /class="st0"/g,
            'class="st0" fill="var(--color-black-very-dark)"'
          );
          // st1 -> fill: var(--color-gray-dark)
          content = content.replace(
            /class="st1"/g,
            'class="st1" fill="var(--color-gray-dark)"'
          );
          // st2 -> fill: var(--color-white), fillRule: evenodd
          content = content.replace(
            /class="st2"/g,
            'class="st2" fill="var(--color-white)" fillRule="evenodd"'
          );
          // st3 -> fill: var(--color-dark)
          content = content.replace(
            /class="st3"/g,
            'class="st3" fill="var(--color-dark)"'
          );
          // st4 -> fill: var(--color-accent-red)
          content = content.replace(
            /class="st4"/g,
            'class="st4" fill="var(--color-accent-red)"'
          );
          // st5 -> fill: var(--color-gray-medium)
          content = content.replace(
            /class="st5"/g,
            'class="st5" fill="var(--color-gray-medium)"'
          );
          // st6 -> fill: var(--color-cream)
          content = content.replace(
            /class="st6"/g,
            'class="st6" fill="var(--color-cream)"'
          );
          // st7 -> fill: var(--color-cream), stroke: var(--color-black), strokeMiterlimit: 10, strokeWidth: 15px
          content = content.replace(
            /class="st7"/g,
            'class="st7" fill="var(--color-cream)" stroke="var(--color-black)" strokeMiterlimit="10" strokeWidth="15"'
          );
          // st8 -> fill: var(--color-black-darkest)
          content = content.replace(
            /class="st8"/g,
            'class="st8" fill="var(--color-black-darkest)"'
          );
          
          // Add class to the letter shapes group (Layer_1-2 contains all the text/letter paths)
          content = content.replace(
            /<g[^>]*id="Layer_1-2"[^>]*>/,
            '<g id="Layer_1-2" class="logo-letters">'
          );
          
          // Add class to the first row group (CLAIM letters)
          // Pattern: logo-letters > g > g (first one) - matches the first <g> after the parent <g>
          content = content.replace(
            /(<g[^>]*class="logo-letters"[^>]*>\s*<g>\s*)(<g>)/,
            '$1<g class="ClaimLetters">'
          );
          
          // Add class to the second row group (RECORDS letters)
          // Pattern: after the first inner g closes (</g>), the next <g> that starts the RECORDS row
          content = content.replace(
            /(<\/g>\s*)(<g>\s*<path[^>]*class="st3"[^>]*fill="var\(--color-dark\)"[^>]*d="M989)/,
            '$1<g class="RecordsLetters"><path class="st3" fill="var(--color-dark)" d="M989'
          );
          
          // Add individual classes to CLAIM letter paths (match by unique d attribute start)
          // C
          content = content.replace(
            /(<path[^>]*class="st3"[^>]*fill="var\(--color-dark\)"[^>]*d="M1136,345\.5)/,
            '<path class="st3 ClaimLetter_C" fill="var(--color-dark)" d="M1136,345.5'
          );
          // L
          content = content.replace(
            /(<path[^>]*class="st3"[^>]*fill="var\(--color-dark\)"[^>]*d="M1261\.3,259\.3)/,
            '<path class="st3 ClaimLetter_L" fill="var(--color-dark)" d="M1261.3,259.3'
          );
          // A
          content = content.replace(
            /(<path[^>]*class="st3"[^>]*fill="var\(--color-dark\)"[^>]*d="M1609\.7,542\.1)/,
            '<path class="st3 ClaimLetter_A" fill="var(--color-dark)" d="M1609.7,542.1'
          );
          // I
          content = content.replace(
            /(<path[^>]*class="st3"[^>]*fill="var\(--color-dark\)"[^>]*d="M1740\.3,259\.3)/,
            '<path class="st3 ClaimLetter_I" fill="var(--color-dark)" d="M1740.3,259.3'
          );
          // M
          content = content.replace(
            /(<path[^>]*class="st3"[^>]*fill="var\(--color-dark\)"[^>]*d="M1954\.4,587\.4)/,
            '<path class="st3 ClaimLetter_M" fill="var(--color-dark)" d="M1954.4,587.4'
          );
          
          // Add individual classes to RECORDS letter paths (match by unique d attribute start)
          // R (first)
          content = content.replace(
            /(<path[^>]*class="st3"[^>]*fill="var\(--color-dark\)"[^>]*d="M989\.1,856)/,
            '<path class="st3 RecordsLetter_R" fill="var(--color-dark)" d="M989.1,856'
          );
          // E
          content = content.replace(
            /(<path[^>]*class="st3"[^>]*fill="var\(--color-dark\)"[^>]*d="M1188\.8,632\.6)/,
            '<path class="st3 RecordsLetter_E" fill="var(--color-dark)" d="M1188.8,632.6'
          );
          // C
          content = content.replace(
            /(<path[^>]*class="st3"[^>]*fill="var\(--color-dark\)"[^>]*d="M1660\.7,718\.8)/,
            '<path class="st3 RecordsLetter_C" fill="var(--color-dark)" d="M1660.7,718.8'
          );
          // Add class to the O group (the group containing the O letter path)
          // Find the <g> tag that directly contains the path with d="M2177,856"
          // Match the pattern: <g>...<path d="M2177,856" (without a closing </g> in between)
          content = content.replace(
            /(<g)([^>]*>)((?:(?!<\/g>)[\s\S])*?<path[^>]*d="M2177,856)/,
            (match, tag, gAttributes, rest) => {
              // Check if the group already has a class attribute
              if (gAttributes.includes('class=')) {
                return `${tag}${gAttributes.replace(/class="([^"]*)"/, 'class="$1 O_group"')}${rest}`;
              } else {
                // Add class to the opening g tag
                return `${tag}${gAttributes.replace(/>/, ' class="O_group">')}${rest}`;
              }
            }
          );
          
          // O -> RecordsLetter_R
          content = content.replace(
            /(<path[^>]*class="st3"[^>]*fill="var\(--color-dark\)"[^>]*d="M2177,856)/,
            '<path class="st3 RecordsLetter_R" fill="var(--color-dark)" d="M2177,856'
          );
          // R (second) -> RecordsLetter_D
          content = content.replace(
            /(<path[^>]*class="st3"[^>]*fill="var\(--color-dark\)"[^>]*d="M2376\.6,632\.6)/,
            '<path class="st3 RecordsLetter_D" fill="var(--color-dark)" d="M2376.6,632.6'
          );
          // D -> RecordsLetter_S
          content = content.replace(
            /(<path[^>]*class="st3"[^>]*fill="var\(--color-dark\)"[^>]*d="M2867\.4,707\.4)/,
            '<path class="st3 RecordsLetter_S" fill="var(--color-dark)" d="M2867.4,707.4'
          );
          // Add class to the nested group containing the RecordsLetter_O and decorative path
          // Find the <g> tag that contains the path with d="M2058,796.2"
          content = content.replace(
            /(<g)([^>]*>)((?:(?!<\/g>)[\s\S])*?<path[^>]*d="M2058,796\.2)/,
            (match, tag, gAttributes, rest) => {
              // Check if the group already has a class attribute
              if (gAttributes.includes('class=')) {
                return `${tag}${gAttributes.replace(/class="([^"]*)"/, 'class="$1 o_g_"')}${rest}`;
              } else {
                // Add class to the opening g tag
                return `${tag}${gAttributes.replace(/>/, ' class="o_g_">')}${rest}`;
              }
            }
          );
          
          // S (inside nested g) -> RecordsLetter_S
          content = content.replace(
            /(<path[^>]*class="st3"[^>]*fill="var\(--color-dark\)"[^>]*d="M2058,796\.2)/,
            '<path class="st3 RecordsLetter_O" fill="var(--color-dark)" d="M2058,796.2'
          );
          
          // Add class to the white decorative path (inside the O letter)
          // Match by the unique d attribute start (M2012.9,720.4)
          content = content.replace(
            /(<path)([^>]*d="M2012\.9,720\.4[^"]*"[^>]*>)/,
            (match, tag, rest) => {
              // Check if it already has a class attribute
              if (rest.includes('class=')) {
                return `${tag}${rest.replace(/class="([^"]*)"/, 'class="$1 RecordsLetter_O_Decorative"')}`;
              } else {
                // Add class attribute before the closing >
                return `${tag}${rest.replace(/>/, ' class="RecordsLetter_O_Decorative">')}`;
              }
            }
          );
          
          // Add class to the circle icon group (the group that comes after Layer_1-2 and contains the circles)
          // Match the pattern: closing Layer_1-2 group, then opening the circle group with a circle element
          content = content.replace(
            /(<\/g>\s*<\/g>\s*<g>\s*<circle[^>]*class="st7"[^>]*fill="var\(--color-cream\)"[^>]*stroke="var\(--color-black\)")/,
            '</g></g><g class="logo-circle-icon ClaimIcon"><circle class="st7" fill="var(--color-cream)" stroke="var(--color-black)"'
          );
          
          // Remove all style classes (st0-st8) from class attributes, keeping other classes
          content = content.replace(
            /class="([^"]*)"/g,
            (match, classes) => {
              const classList = classes.split(/\s+/).filter((cls: string) => cls && !cls.match(/^st[0-8]$/));
              return classList.length > 0 ? `class="${classList.join(' ')}"` : '';
            }
          );
          
          // Clean up any empty class attributes
          content = content.replace(/\s+class=""/g, '');
          
          setSvgContent(content);
        }
      })
      .catch((err) => console.error('Failed to load SVG:', err));
  }, []);

  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen bg-gray-200 flex items-center justify-center p-4">
      <div className="bg-white rounded-lg shadow-lg p-12 max-w-4xl w-full">
        <div className="flex items-center justify-center">
          <motion.svg
            xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
            version="1.1"
            viewBox="0 0 2883.2 1043.9"
            className="w-full h-auto"
            initial={{ opacity: 0 }}
            animate={{ opacity: 1 }}
            transition={{ duration: 0.5 }}
          >
            {svgContent && (
              <g dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{ __html: svgContent }} />
            )}
          </motion.svg>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}
```

```tailwindcss
/* Jitter animation for RecordsLetter_O_Decorative - vinyl record shine effect */
@keyframes vinylShine {
  0% {
    transform: translate(-0.8px, 0.8px) rotate(0deg);
    opacity: 0.4;
  }
  12.5% {
    transform: translate(0.6px, -0.6px) rotate(0.3deg);
    opacity: 0.55;
  }
  25% {
    transform: translate(-0.5px, -0.5px) rotate(-0.2deg);
    opacity: 0.7;
  }
  37.5% {
    transform: translate(0.7px, 0.5px) rotate(0.4deg);
    opacity: 0.85;
  }
  50% {
    transform: translate(-0.6px, 0.4px) rotate(-0.15deg);
    opacity: 1;
  }
  62.5% {
    transform: translate(0.5px, -0.7px) rotate(0.25deg);
    opacity: 0.9;
  }
  75% {
    transform: translate(-0.4px, 0.6px) rotate(-0.3deg);
    opacity: 0.75;
  }
  87.5% {
    transform: translate(0.6px, -0.4px) rotate(0.2deg);
    opacity: 0.6;
  }
  100% {
    transform: translate(-0.8px, 0.8px) rotate(0deg);
    opacity: 0.4;
  }
}

.RecordsLetter_O_Decorative {
  animation: vinylShine 1.2s cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.6, 1) infinite;
  transform-origin: center;
  will-change: transform, opacity;
}

/* Slow bouncing animation for nested group containing RecordsLetter_O and decorative path */
@keyframes slowBounce {
  0%, 100% {
    transform: translateY(0);
  }
  50% {
    transform: translateY(-3px);
  }
}

.o_g_ {
  animation: slowBounce 3s ease-in-out infinite;
  transform-origin: center;
  will-change: transform;
```

```tailwindcss
.hero-grid,
.hero-grid *,
.hero-grid a,
.hero-grid a *,
.hero-grid img,
.hero-grid span {
  transition: none !important;
}

html {
  scroll-behavior: smooth;
}

body {
  overflow-x: hidden;
  line-height: 1.65;
  background-color: #fff;
  padding: 0;
}

main {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 0;
}

section {

  padding-top: 0;

.artists .hero {
  height: 70vh;
  overflow: hidden;

}

/* Hero Grid - Homepage background grid (3x2) */
.hero-grid {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: repeat(3, 1fr);
  grid-template-rows: repeat(2, 1fr);
  gap: 0;
  z-index: 0;
}

.hero-grid > * {
  position: relative;
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  display: block;
  /* GPU acceleration for smooth animations */
  will-change: transform, opacity;
  transform: translateZ(0);
  backface-visibility: hidden;
}

.thumbs {
  width: 100%;
  position: absolute;
  transform: translate(-50%, -50%);
  left: 50%;
  top: 50%;
  height: 100vh;
  transition: all;
  z-index: 0;
  overflow: hidden;
}

.artist.thumbs {
  width: 100%;
  position: relative;
  height: 75vh;
  transition: all;
  z-index: 0;
  transform: none;
  left: auto;
  top: auto;
}

/* Artists page uses hero-grid styling */
.artists .hero-grid {
  height: 50vh;
}

@media (min-width: 768px) {
  .artists .hero-grid {
    height: 100vh;
  }
}

.artists .artist.thumbs {
  height: 75vh;
}

/* Featured card thumbnail container - gradient background */
.featured-thumb-container {
  background: linear-gradient(135deg, #d0d0d0 0%, #b8b8b8 100%);
}

/* Featured thumbnails - mobile: centered and enlarged */
.featured-thumb-mobile {
  position: absolute !important;
  width: 100% !important;
  height: 100% !important;
  object-fit: cover !important;
  object-position: center center !important;
  left: 0 !important;
  top: 0 !important;
  transform: scale(1.2) !important;
}

/* Featured thumbnails - desktop: original positioning */
@media (min-width: 768px) {
  .featured-thumb-mobile {
    object-position: center top !important;
    top: 0 !important;
    transform: scale(1) !important;
  }
  
  .featured-thumb-desktop {
    object-position: center top !important;
    top: 0 !important;
    transform: scale(1) !important;
  }
}

.artist__name {
  font-size: 2em;
  margin-bottom: 0;
  display: inline-block;
  line-height: 1;
  text-transform: uppercase;
  position: absolute;
  left: 50%;
  top: 50%;
  transform: translate(-50%, -50%);
  background: #000;
  padding: 4px 8px;
  z-index: 9;
  opacity: 1;
  width: auto;
  color: white;
  text-align: center;
}

/* Disable transitions for artist__name when inside Framer Motion components */
[data-framer-component] .artist__name,
.hero-grid .artist__name {
  transition: opacity 0.15s linear !important;
}

a .artist__name {
  opacity: 0;
}

a:hover .artist__name,
.group:hover .artist__name {

}

.card .thumb {

.thumb a .artwork {
  position: absolute;
  width: auto;
  height: 100%;
  transform: translate(-50%, -50%);
  left: 50%;
  top: 50%;
  z-index: 0;
  -webkit-filter: sepia(80%);
  filter: sepia(80%);
  opacity: 0.55;
}

.thumb a:hover .artwork {
  width: auto;
  height: 110%;
  -webkit-filter: saturate(100%);
  filter: saturate(100%);
  opacity: 1;
}

.artist.thumbs .thumb a:hover .artwork {

/* Jitter animation for RecordsLetter_O_Decorative - vinyl record shine effect */
@keyframes vinylShine {
  0% {
    transform: translate(-0.8px, 0.8px) rotate(0deg);
    opacity: 0.4;
  }
  12.5% {
    transform: translate(0.6px, -0.6px) rotate(0.3deg);
    opacity: 0.55;
  }
  25% {
    transform: translate(-0.5px, -0.5px) rotate(-0.2deg);
    opacity: 0.7;
  }
  37.5% {
    transform: translate(0.7px, 0.5px) rotate(0.4deg);
    opacity: 0.85;
  }
  50% {
    transform: translate(-0.6px, 0.4px) rotate(-0.15deg);
    opacity: 1;
  }
  62.5% {
    transform: translate(0.5px, -0.7px) rotate(0.25deg);
    opacity: 0.9;
  }
  75% {
    transform: translate(-0.4px, 0.6px) rotate(-0.3deg);
    opacity: 0.75;
  }
  87.5% {
    transform: translate(0.6px, -0.4px) rotate(0.2deg);
    opacity: 0.6;
  }
  100% {
    transform: translate(-0.8px, 0.8px) rotate(0deg);
    opacity: 0.4;
  }
}

.RecordsLetter_O_Decorative {
  animation: vinylShine 1.2s cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.6, 1) infinite;
  transform-origin: center;
  will-change: transform, opacity;
}

/* Slow bouncing animation for nested group containing RecordsLetter_O and decorative path */
@keyframes slowBounce {
  0%, 100% {
    transform: translateY(0);
  }
  50% {
    transform: translateY(-3px);
  }
}

.o_g_ {
  animation: slowBounce 3s ease-in-out infinite;
  transform-origin: center;
  will-change: transform;
}

.RecordsLetter_O {
  animation: slowBounce 3s ease-in-out infinite;
  transform-origin: center;
  will-change: transform;
}
```

```tailwindcss
  50% {
    transform: translate(-0.6px, 0.4px) rotate(-0.15deg);
    opacity: 1;
  }
  62.5% {
    transform: translate(0.5px, -0.7px) rotate(0.25deg);
    opacity: 0.9;
  }
  75% {
    transform: translate(-0.4px, 0.6px) rotate(-0.3deg);
    opacity: 0.75;
  }
  87.5% {
    transform: translate(0.6px, -0.4px) rotate(0.2deg);
    opacity: 0.6;
  }
  100% {
    transform: translate(-0.8px, 0.8px) rotate(0deg);
    opacity: 0.4;
  }
}

.RecordsLetter_O_Decorative {

  will-change: transform;

  transform-origin: center;
```

Added a slow scale effect to the `RecordsLetter_O` element. It now uses a combined animation (`slowBounceScale`) that:

1. **Bounces up** 3px (same as before)
2. **Scales to 1.2** at the peak of the bounce
3. **Returns to original position and scale** (scale 1) at the start/end

The animation runs over 3 seconds with `ease-in-out` timing, so the element bounces and scales smoothly together.

```tailwindcss
/* Jitter animation for RecordsLetter_O_Decorative - vinyl record shine effect */
@keyframes vinylShine {
  0% {
    transform: translate(-0.8px, 0.8px) rotate(0deg);
    opacity: 0.4;
  }
  12.5% {
    transform: translate(0.6px, -0.6px) rotate(0.3deg);
    opacity: 0.55;
  }
  25% {
    transform: translate(-0.5px, -0.5px) rotate(-0.2deg);
    opacity: 0.7;
  }
  37.5% {
    transform: translate(0.7px, 0.5px) rotate(0.4deg);
    opacity: 0.85;
  }
  50% {
    transform: translate(-0.6px, 0.4px) rotate(-0.15deg);
    opacity: 1;
  }
  62.5% {
    transform: translate(0.5px, -0.7px) rotate(0.25deg);
    opacity: 0.9;
  }
  75% {
    transform: translate(-0.4px, 0.6px) rotate(-0.3deg);
    opacity: 0.75;
  }
  87.5% {
    transform: translate(0.6px, -0.4px) rotate(0.2deg);
    opacity: 0.6;
  }
  100% {
    transform: translate(-0.8px, 0.8px) rotate(0deg);
    opacity: 0.4;
  }
}

.RecordsLetter_O_Decorative {

  transform-origin: center;
```

```tailwindcss
@keyframes fanInFromLeft {

  100% {
```

```tailwindcss
/* Jitter animation for RecordsLetter_O_Decorative - vinyl record shine effect */
@keyframes vinylShine {
  0% {
    transform: translate(-0.8px, 0.8px) rotate(0deg);
    opacity: 0.4;
  }
  12.5% {
    transform: translate(0.6px, -0.6px) rotate(0.3deg);
    opacity: 0.55;
  }
  25% {
    transform: translate(-0.5px, -0.5px) rotate(-0.2deg);
    opacity: 0.7;
  }
  37.5% {
    transform: translate(0.7px, 0.5px) rotate(0.4deg);
    opacity: 0.85;
  }
  50% {
    transform: translate(-0.6px, 0.4px) rotate(-0.15deg);
    opacity: 1;
  }
  62.5% {
    transform: translate(0.5px, -0.7px) rotate(0.25deg);
    opacity: 0.9;
  }
  75% {
    transform: translate(-0.4px, 0.6px) rotate(-0.3deg);
    opacity: 0.75;
  }
  87.5% {
    transform: translate(0.6px, -0.4px) rotate(0.2deg);
    opacity: 0.6;
  }
  100% {
    transform: translate(-0.8px, 0.8px) rotate(0deg);
    opacity: 0.4;
  }
}

.RecordsLetter_O_Decorative {
  animation: vinylShine 1.2s cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.6, 1) infinite;
  transform-origin: center;
  will-change: transform, opacity;
}

/* Slow bouncing animation for nested group containing RecordsLetter_O and decorative path */
@keyframes slowBounce {
  0%, 100% {
    transform: translateY(0);
  }
  50% {
    transform: translateY(-3px);
  }
}

.o_g_ {
  animation: slowBounce 3s ease-in-out infinite;
  transform-origin: center;
  will-change: transform;
}

.RecordsLetter_O {
  animation: slowBounce 3s ease-in-out infinite;
  transform-origin: center;
  will-change: transform;
}

/* Staggered fan-in animations for CLAIM letters */
@keyframes fanInFromLeft {
  0% {
    opacity: 0;
    transform: translateX(-30px) translateY(10px) scale(0.8) rotate(-5deg);
  }
  100% {
    opacity: 1;
    transform: translateX(0) translateY(0) scale(1) rotate(0deg);
  }
}

@keyframes fanInFromRight {
  0% {
    opacity: 0;
    transform: translateX(30px) translateY(-10px) scale(0.8) rotate(5deg);
  }
  100% {
    opacity: 1;
    transform: translateX(0) translateY(0) scale(1) rotate(0deg);
  }
}

@keyframes fanInFromTop {
  0% {
    opacity: 0;
    transform: translateY(-25px) scale(0.7) rotate(3deg);
  }
  100% {
    opacity: 1;
    transform: translateY(0) scale(1) rotate(0deg);
  }
}

@keyframes fanInFromBottom {
  0% {
    opacity: 0;
    transform: translateY(25px) scale(0.7) rotate(-3deg);
  }
  100% {
    opacity: 1;
    transform: translateY(0) scale(1) rotate(0deg);
  }
}

@keyframes fanInFromCenter {
  0% {
    opacity: 0;
    transform: scale(0.3) rotate(10deg);
  }
  100% {
    opacity: 1;
    transform: scale(1) rotate(0deg);
  }
}

/* CLAIM Letters - Creative staggered fan-in */
.ClaimLetter_C {
  animation: fanInFromLeft 0.8s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1) forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 0.1s;
}

.ClaimLetter_L {
  animation: fanInFromTop 0.8s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1) forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 0.25s;
}

.ClaimLetter_A {
  animation: fanInFromCenter 0.8s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1) forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 0.4s;
}

/* RECORDS Letters - Creative staggered fan-in */
```

```tailwindcss
/* Disable transitions for Framer Motion components and hero grid */
[data-framer-component],
[data-framer-component] *,
.hero-grid,
.hero-grid *,
.hero-grid a,
.hero-grid a *,
.hero-grid img,
.hero-grid span {
  transition: none !important;
}

html {

/* Hero Grid - Homepage background grid (3x2) */
.hero-grid {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: repeat(3, 1fr);
  grid-template-rows: repeat(2, 1fr);
  gap: 0;
  z-index: 0;
}

.hero-grid > * {
  position: relative;
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  display: block;
  /* GPU acceleration for smooth animations */
  will-change: transform, opacity;
  transform: translateZ(0);
  backface-visibility: hidden;
}

.thumbs {
  width: 100%;
  position: absolute;
  transform: translate(-50%, -50%);
  left: 50%;
  top: 50%;
  height: 100vh;
  transition: all;
  z-index: 0;
  overflow: hidden;
}

.artist.thumbs {
  width: 100%;
  position: relative;
  height: 75vh;
  transition: all;
  z-index: 0;
  transform: none;
  left: auto;
  top: auto;
}

/* Artists page uses hero-grid styling */
.artists .hero-grid {
  height: 50vh;
}

@media (min-width: 768px) {
  .artists .hero-grid {

/* Featured thumbnails - mobile: centered and enlarged */
.featured-thumb-mobile {
  position: absolute !important;
  width: 100% !important;
  height: 100% !important;
  object-fit: cover !important;
  object-position: center center !important;
  left: 0 !important;
  top: 0 !important;
  transform: scale(1.2) !important;
}

/* Featured thumbnails - desktop: original positioning */
@media (min-width: 768px) {
  .featured-thumb-mobile {
    object-position: center top !important;
    top: 0 !important;
    transform: scale(1) !important;
  }
  
  .featured-thumb-desktop {

  }

/* Jitter animation for RecordsLetter_O_Decorative - vinyl record shine effect */
@keyframes vinylShine {
  0% {
    transform: translate(-0.8px, 0.8px) rotate(0deg);
    opacity: 0.4;
  }
  12.5% {
    transform: translate(0.6px, -0.6px) rotate(0.3deg);
    opacity: 0.55;
  }
  25% {
    transform: translate(-0.5px, -0.5px) rotate(-0.2deg);
    opacity: 0.7;
  }
  37.5% {
    transform: translate(0.7px, 0.5px) rotate(0.4deg);
    opacity: 0.85;
  }
  50% {
    transform: translate(-0.6px, 0.4px) rotate(-0.15deg);
    opacity: 1;
  }
  62.5% {
    transform: translate(0.5px, -0.7px) rotate(0.25deg);
    opacity: 0.9;
  }
  75% {
    transform: translate(-0.4px, 0.6px) rotate(-0.3deg);
    opacity: 0.75;
  }
  87.5% {
    transform: translate(0.6px, -0.4px) rotate(0.2deg);
    opacity: 0.6;
  }
  100% {
    transform: translate(-0.8px, 0.8px) rotate(0deg);
    opacity: 0.4;
  }
}

.RecordsLetter_O_Decorative {
  animation: vinylShine 1.2s cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.6, 1) infinite;
  transform-origin: center;
  will-change: transform, opacity;
}

/* Slow bouncing animation for nested group containing RecordsLetter_O and decorative path */
@keyframes slowBounce {
  0%, 100% {
    transform: translateY(0);
  }
  50% {
    transform: translateY(-3px);
  }
}

.o_g_ {
  animation: slowBounce 3s ease-in-out infinite;
  transform-origin: center;
  will-change: transform;
}

.RecordsLetter_O {
  animation: slowBounce 3s ease-in-out infinite;
  animation-delay: 2.1s; /* Start after fan-in completes (0.8s + 1.3s delay) */
  transform-origin: center;
  will-change: transform;
}

/* Staggered fan-in animations for CLAIM letters */
@keyframes fanInFromLeft {
  0% {
    opacity: 0;
    transform: translateX(-30px) translateY(10px) scale(0.8) rotate(-5deg);
  }
  100% {
    opacity: 1;
    transform: translateX(0) translateY(0) scale(1) rotate(0deg);
  }
}

@keyframes fanInFromRight {
  0% {
    opacity: 0;
    transform: translateX(30px) translateY(-10px) scale(0.8) rotate(5deg);
  }
  100% {
    opacity: 1;
    transform: translateX(0) translateY(0) scale(1) rotate(0deg);
  }
}

@keyframes fanInFromTop {
  0% {
    opacity: 0;
    transform: translateY(-25px) scale(0.7) rotate(3deg);
  }
  100% {
    opacity: 1;
    transform: translateY(0) scale(1) rotate(0deg);
  }
}

@keyframes fanInFromBottom {
  0% {
    opacity: 0;
    transform: translateY(25px) scale(0.7) rotate(-3deg);
  }
  100% {
    opacity: 1;
    transform: translateY(0) scale(1) rotate(0deg);
  }
}

@keyframes fanInFromCenter {
  0% {
    opacity: 0;
    transform: scale(0.3) rotate(10deg);
  }
  100% {
    opacity: 1;
    transform: scale(1) rotate(0deg);
  }
}

/* CLAIM Letters - Creative staggered fan-in */
.ClaimLetter_C {
  animation: fanInFromLeft 0.8s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1) forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 0.1s;
}

.ClaimLetter_L {
  animation: fanInFromTop 0.8s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1) forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 0.25s;
}

.ClaimLetter_A {
  animation: fanInFromCenter 0.8s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1) forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 0.4s;
}

.ClaimLetter_I {
  animation: fanInFromBottom 0.8s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1) forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 0.55s;
}

.ClaimLetter_M {
  animation: fanInFromRight 0.8s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1) forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 0.7s;
}

/* RECORDS Letters - Creative staggered fan-in */
/* First R in RECORDS */
.RecordsLetters > .RecordsLetter_R:first-of-type,
.RecordsLetters .RecordsLetter_R:first-child {
  animation: fanInFromLeft 0.8s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1) forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 0.85s;
}

.RecordsLetter_E {
  animation: fanInFromTop 0.8s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1) forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 1s;
}

.RecordsLetter_C {
  animation: fanInFromCenter 0.8s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1) forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 1.15s;
}

/* O letter (RecordsLetter_R with O_group) - special entrance */
.O_group {
  animation: fanInFromBottom 0.8s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1) forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 1.3s;
}

.RecordsLetter_D {
  animation: fanInFromRight 0.8s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1) forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 1.45s;
}

.RecordsLetter_S {
  animation: fanInFromLeft 0.8s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1) forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 1.6s;
}
```

```tailwindcss
  0% {

    transform: translateX(-30px) translateY(10px) scale(0.8) rotate(-5deg);
  }
  100% {
    opacity: 1;
    transform: translateX(0) translateY(0) scale(1) rotate(0deg);
  }
}

@keyframes fanInFromRight {
  0% {
    opacity: 0;
    transform: translateX(30px) translateY(-10px) scale(0.8) rotate(5deg);
  }
  100% {
    opacity: 1;
    transform: translateX(0) translateY(0) scale(1) rotate(0deg);
  }
}

@keyframes fanInFromTop {
  0% {
    opacity: 0;
    transform: translateY(-25px) scale(0.7) rotate(3deg);
  }
  100% {
    opacity: 1;
    transform: translateY(0) scale(1) rotate(0deg);
  }
}

@keyframes fanInFromBottom {
  0% {
    opacity: 0;
    transform: translateY(25px) scale(0.7) rotate(-3deg);
  }
  100% {
    opacity: 1;
    transform: translateY(0) scale(1) rotate(0deg);
  }
}

@keyframes fanInFromCenter {
  0% {
    opacity: 0;
    transform: scale(0.3) rotate(10deg);
  }
  100% {
    opacity: 1;
    transform: scale(1) rotate(0deg);
  }
}

/* CLAIM Letters - Creative staggered fan-in */
.ClaimLetter_C {
  animation: fanInFromLeft 0.8s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1) forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 0.1s;
}

.ClaimLetter_L {
  animation: fanInFromTop 0.8s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1) forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 0.25s;
}

.ClaimLetter_A {
  animation: fanInFromCenter 0.8s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1) forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 0.4s;
}

.ClaimLetter_I {
  animation: fanInFromBottom 0.8s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1) forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 0.55s;
}

.ClaimLetter_M {
  animation: fanInFromRight 0.8s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1) forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 0.7s;
}

/* RECORDS Letters - Creative staggered fan-in */
/* First R in RECORDS */
.RecordsLetters > .RecordsLetter_R:first-of-type,
.RecordsLetters .RecordsLetter_R:first-child {
  animation: fanInFromLeft 0.8s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1) forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 0.85s;
}

.RecordsLetter_E {
  animation: fanInFromTop 0.8s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1) forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 1s;
}

.RecordsLetter_C {
  animation: fanInFromCenter 0.8s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1) forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 1.15s;
}

/* O letter (RecordsLetter_R with O_group) - special entrance */
.O_group {
  animation: fanInFromBottom 0.8s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1) forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 1.3s;
}

.RecordsLetter_D {
  animation: fanInFromRight 0.8s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1) forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 1.45s;
}

.RecordsLetter_S {
  animation: fanInFromLeft 0.8s cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1) forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 1.6s;
}
```


Added staggered fan-in animations for all letters in CLAIM and RECORDS.

**CLAIM Letters** (staggered delays: 0.1s, 0.25s, 0.4s, 0.55s, 0.7s):
- **C**: Enters from left with rotation
- **L**: Enters from top
- **A**: Scales up from center (pop effect)
- **I**: Enters from bottom
- **M**: Enters from right with rotation

**RECORDS Letters** (staggered delays: 0.85s, 1s, 1.15s, 1.3s, 1.45s, 1.6s):
- **R** (first): Enters from left
- **E**: Enters from top
- **C**: Scales up from center
- **O** (O_group): Enters from bottom
- **D**: Enters from right
- **S**: Enters from left

**Features:**
- Each letter uses a different entry direction for a fan effect
- Bouncy easing curve (`cubic-bezier(0.34, 1.56, 0.64, 1)`) for a playful bounce
- Staggered delays create a cascading wave
- Bounce and vinyl shine animations are delayed until after the fan-in completes (2.1s)

The letters now animate in with a staggered, fan-like entrance.

---

**User**

Not so sporatic and loose. The letters should stay in place. the prescence transition should only apply to the opacity

---

**Cursor**

Simplifying animations to opacity-only fades with staggered delays, removing transforms:

```tailwindcss
  background: linear-gradient(135deg, #d0d0d0 0%, #b8b8b8 100%);
}

/* Featured thumbnails - mobile: centered and enlarged */
.featured-thumb-mobile {
  position: absolute !important;
  width: 100% !important;
  height: 100% !important;
  object-fit: cover !important;
  object-position: center center !important;
  left: 0 !important;
  top: 0 !important;
  transform: scale(1.2) !important;
}

/* Featured thumbnails - desktop: original positioning */
@media (min-width: 768px) {
  .featured-thumb-mobile {
    object-position: center top !important;
    top: 0 !important;
    transform: scale(1) !important;
  }
  
  .featured-thumb-desktop {
    object-position: center top !important;
    top: 0 !important;
    transform: scale(1) !important;
  }
}

.artist__name {
  font-size: 2em;
  margin-bottom: 0;
  display: inline-block;
  line-height: 1;
  text-transform: uppercase;
  position: absolute;
  left: 50%;
  top: 50%;
  transform: translate(-50%, -50%);
  background: #000;
  padding: 4px 8px;
  z-index: 9;
  opacity: 1;
  width: auto;
  color: white;
  text-align: center;
}

/* Disable transitions for artist__name when inside Framer Motion components */
[data-framer-component] .artist__name,
.hero-grid .artist__name {
  transition: opacity 0.15s linear !important;
}

a .artist__name {
  opacity: 0;
}

a:hover .artist__name,
.group:hover .artist__name {
  opacity: 1;
}

.thumb {
  display: flex;
  background-color: white;
  border: none;

  overflow: hidden;
  z-index: 0;
}

.artist.thumbs .thumb {
  flex: 0 0 33.333333%;
  width: 33.333333%;
}

.card .thumb {
  display: block;
  background-color: white;
  border: none;
  width: 100%;
  position: relative;
  overflow: hidden;
  z-index: 0;
  height: 170px;
}

.shop .card .thumb {
  height: 340px;
}

.products .card .thumb {
  height: 200px;
}

.releases .card .thumb {
  height: 250px;
}

.thumb a .artwork {
  position: absolute;
  width: auto;
  height: 100%;
  transform: translate(-50%, -50%);
  left: 50%;
  top: 50%;
  z-index: 0;
  -webkit-filter: sepia(80%);
  filter: sepia(80%);
  opacity: 0.55;
}

.thumb a:hover .artwork {
  width: auto;
  height: 110%;
  -webkit-filter: saturate(100%);
  filter: saturate(100%);
  opacity: 1;
}

.artist.thumbs .thumb a:hover .artwork {
  height: 110% !important;
  filter: saturate(100%) !important;
  opacity: 1 !important;
}

.animate-fade-in {
  animation: fadeIn 0.5s ease-in;
}

@keyframes fadeIn {
  from {
    opacity: 0;
  }
  to {
    opacity: 1;
  }
}

/* Jitter animation for RecordsLetter_O_Decorative - vinyl record shine effect */
@keyframes vinylShine {
  0% {
    transform: translate(-0.8px, 0.8px) rotate(0deg);
    opacity: 0.4;
  }
  12.5% {
    transform: translate(0.6px, -0.6px) rotate(0.3deg);
    opacity: 0.55;
  }
  25% {
    transform: translate(-0.5px, -0.5px) rotate(-0.2deg);
    opacity: 0.7;
  }
  37.5% {
    transform: translate(0.7px, 0.5px) rotate(0.4deg);
    opacity: 0.85;
  }
  50% {
    transform: translate(-0.6px, 0.4px) rotate(-0.15deg);
    opacity: 1;
  }
  62.5% {
    transform: translate(0.5px, -0.7px) rotate(0.25deg);
    opacity: 0.9;
  }
  75% {
    transform: translate(-0.4px, 0.6px) rotate(-0.3deg);
    opacity: 0.75;
  }
  87.5% {
    transform: translate(0.6px, -0.4px) rotate(0.2deg);
    opacity: 0.6;
  }
  100% {
    transform: translate(-0.8px, 0.8px) rotate(0deg);
    opacity: 0.4;
  }
}

.RecordsLetter_O_Decorative {
  animation: vinylShine 1.2s cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.6, 1) infinite;
  animation-delay: 2.1s; /* Start after fan-in completes (0.8s + 1.3s delay) */
  transform-origin: center;
  will-change: transform, opacity;
}

/* Slow bouncing animation for nested group containing RecordsLetter_O and decorative path */
@keyframes slowBounce {
  0%, 100% {
    transform: translateY(0);
  }
  50% {
    transform: translateY(-3px);
  }
}

.o_g_ {
  animation: slowBounce 3s ease-in-out infinite;
  animation-delay: 2.1s; /* Start after fan-in completes (0.8s + 1.3s delay) */
  transform-origin: center;
  will-change: transform;
}

.RecordsLetter_O {
  animation: slowBounce 3s ease-in-out infinite;
  animation-delay: 2.1s; /* Start after fan-in completes (0.8s + 1.3s delay) */
  transform-origin: center;
  will-change: transform;
}

/* Staggered fade-in animation - opacity only */
@keyframes fadeIn {
  0% {
    opacity: 0;
  }
  100% {
    opacity: 1;
  }
}

/* CLAIM Letters - Staggered fade-in */
.ClaimLetter_C {
  animation: fadeIn 0.6s ease-out forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 0.1s;
}

.ClaimLetter_L {
  animation: fadeIn 0.6s ease-out forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 0.2s;
}

.ClaimLetter_A {
  animation: fadeIn 0.6s ease-out forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 0.3s;
}

.ClaimLetter_I {
  animation: fadeIn 0.6s ease-out forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 0.4s;
}

.ClaimLetter_M {
  animation: fadeIn 0.6s ease-out forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 0.5s;
}

/* RECORDS Letters - Staggered fade-in */
/* First R in RECORDS */
.RecordsLetters > .RecordsLetter_R:first-of-type,
.RecordsLetters .RecordsLetter_R:first-child {
  animation: fadeIn 0.6s ease-out forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 0.6s;
}

.RecordsLetter_E {
  animation: fadeIn 0.6s ease-out forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 0.7s;
}

.RecordsLetter_C {
  animation: fadeIn 0.6s ease-out forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 0.8s;
}

/* O letter (RecordsLetter_R with O_group) - special entrance */
.O_group {
  animation: fadeIn 0.6s ease-out forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 0.9s;
}

.RecordsLetter_D {
  animation: fadeIn 0.6s ease-out forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 1s;
}

.RecordsLetter_S {
  animation: fadeIn 0.6s ease-out forwards;
  opacity: 0;
  animation-delay: 1.1s;
}
```


Simplified the animations to opacity-only fades. Changes:

1. **Removed all transforms** — no translation, rotation, or scaling
2. **Opacity-only fade-in** — letters fade in from 0 to 1
3. **Tighter timing** — 0.1s stagger intervals (0.1s, 0.2s, 0.3s, etc.)
4. **Shorter duration** — 0.6s per letter (was 0.8s)
5. **Smoother easing** — `ease-out` instead of bouncy curves

Letters now fade in sequentially with a staggered effect, staying in place. The bounce and vinyl shine animations start after all letters have faded in (1.7s delay).

```typescriptreact
'use client';

import { motion } from 'framer-motion';
import { useEffect, useState } from 'react';

export default function LogoDisplay() {
  const [svgContent, setSvgContent] = useState<string>('');

  useEffect(() => {
    // Fetch both the main logo and the icon SVG
    Promise.all([
      fetch('/img/logo_ClaimRecords.svg').then((res) => res.text()),
      fetch('/img/claim_ico_.svg').then((res) => res.text())
    ])
      .then(([logoText, iconText]) => {
        // Process the icon SVG first
        const iconSvgMatch = iconText.match(/<svg[^>]*>([\s\S]*)<\/svg>/);
        let iconContent = '';
        
        if (iconSvgMatch) {
          iconContent = iconSvgMatch[1];
          
          // Remove the defs/style block
          iconContent = iconContent.replace(/<defs>[\s\S]*?<\/defs>/g, '');
          
          // Replace style classes with inline fill/stroke attributes using CSS variables
          // cls-1 -> fill: var(--color-black-very-dark)
          iconContent = iconContent.replace(
            /class="cls-1"/g,
            'class="cls-1" fill="var(--color-black-very-dark)"'
          );
          // cls-2 -> fill: var(--color-gray-dark)
          iconContent = iconContent.replace(
            /class="cls-2"/g,
            'class="cls-2" fill="var(--color-gray-dark)"'
          );
          // cls-3 -> fill: var(--color-accent-red)
          iconContent = iconContent.replace(
            /class="cls-3"/g,
            'class="cls-3" fill="var(--color-accent-red)"'
          );
          // cls-4 -> fill: var(--color-gray-medium)
          iconContent = iconContent.replace(
            /class="cls-4"/g,
            'class="cls-4" fill="var(--color-gray-medium)"'
          );
          // cls-5 -> fill: var(--color-cream)
          iconContent = iconContent.replace(
            /class="cls-5"/g,
            'class="cls-5" fill="var(--color-cream)"'
          );
          // cls-6 -> fill: var(--color-black-darkest)
          iconContent = iconContent.replace(
            /class="cls-6"/g,
            'class="cls-6" fill="var(--color-black-darkest)"'
          );
          
          // Remove all style classes (cls-1 through cls-6) from class attributes, keeping other classes
          iconContent = iconContent.replace(
            /class="([^"]*)"/g,
            (match, classes) => {
              const classList = classes.split(/\s+/).filter((cls: string) => cls && !cls.match(/^cls-[1-6]$/));
              return classList.length > 0 ? `class="${classList.join(' ')}"` : '';
            }
          );
          
          // Clean up any empty class attributes
          iconContent = iconContent.replace(/\s+class=""/g, '');
        }
        
        // Process the main logo SVG
        const svgMatch = logoText.match(/<svg[^>]*>([\s\S]*)<\/svg>/);
        if (svgMatch) {
          let content = svgMatch[1];
          
          // Remove the defs/style block
          content = content.replace(/<defs>[\s\S]*?<\/defs>/g, '');
          
          // Replace style classes with inline fill/stroke attributes using CSS variables
          // Keep the class attribute for now, we'll remove style classes at the end
          // st0 -> fill: var(--color-black-very-dark)
          content = content.replace(
            /class="st0"/g,
            'class="st0" fill="var(--color-black-very-dark)"'
          );
          // st1 -> fill: var(--color-gray-dark)
          content = content.replace(
            /class="st1"/g,
            'class="st1" fill="var(--color-gray-dark)"'
          );
          // st2 -> fill: var(--color-white), fillRule: evenodd
          content = content.replace(
            /class="st2"/g,
            'class="st2" fill="var(--color-white)" fillRule="evenodd"'
          );
          // st3 -> fill: var(--color-dark)
          content = content.replace(
            /class="st3"/g,
            'class="st3" fill="var(--color-dark)"'
          );
          // st4 -> fill: var(--color-accent-red)
          content = content.replace(
            /class="st4"/g,
            'class="st4" fill="var(--color-accent-red)"'
          );
          // st5 -> fill: var(--color-gray-medium)
          content = content.replace(
            /class="st5"/g,
            'class="st5" fill="var(--color-gray-medium)"'
          );
          // st6 -> fill: var(--color-cream)
          content = content.replace(
            /class="st6"/g,
            'class="st6" fill="var(--color-cream)"'
          );
          // st7 -> fill: var(--color-cream), stroke: var(--color-black), strokeMiterlimit: 10, strokeWidth: 15px
          content = content.replace(

          );
          // st8 -> fill: var(--color-black-darkest)
```

```typescriptreact
            const circleGroupPattern = /(<\/g>\s*<\/g>\s*)(<g>\s*<circle[^>]*>[\s\S]*?<\/g>)/;
```

Creating a simpler component that loads the SVG dynamically, similar to `LogoDisplay`:


```typescriptreact
'use client';

import { useEffect, useState } from 'react';

export default function ClaimIcon() {
  const [svgContent, setSvgContent] = useState<string>('');

  useEffect(() => {
    fetch('/img/claim_ico_.svg')
      .then((res) => res.text())
      .then((text) => {
        // Remove XML declaration and extract just the SVG content
        const svgMatch = text.match(/<svg[^>]*>([\s\S]*)<\/svg>/);
        if (svgMatch) {
          let content = svgMatch[1];
          
          // Remove the defs/style block
          content = content.replace(/<defs>[\s\S]*?<\/defs>/g, '');
          
          // Replace style classes with inline fill attributes using CSS variables
          content = content.replace(
            /class="cls-1"/g,
            'class="cls-1" fill="var(--color-black-very-dark)"'
          );
          content = content.replace(
            /class="cls-2"/g,
            'class="cls-2" fill="var(--color-gray-dark)"'
          );
          content = content.replace(
            /class="cls-3"/g,
            'class="cls-3" fill="var(--color-accent-red)"'
          );
          content = content.replace(
            /class="cls-4"/g,
            'class="cls-4" fill="var(--color-gray-medium)"'
          );
          content = content.replace(
            /class="cls-5"/g,
            'class="cls-5" fill="var(--color-cream)"'
          );
          content = content.replace(
            /class="cls-6"/g,
            'class="cls-6" fill="var(--color-black-darkest)"'
          );
          
          // Remove all style classes from class attributes, keeping other classes
          content = content.replace(
            /class="([^"]*)"/g,
            (match, classes) => {
              const classList = classes.split(/\s+/).filter((cls: string) => cls && !cls.match(/^cls-[0-9]$/));
              return classList.length > 0 ? `class="${classList.join(' ')}"` : '';
            }
          );
          
          // Clean up any empty class attributes
          content = content.replace(/\s+class=""/g, '');
          
          setSvgContent(content);
        }
      })
      .catch((err) => console.error('Failed to load SVG:', err));
  }, []);

  if (!svgContent) {
    return <div className="flex items-center justify-center p-8">Loading...</div>;
  }

  return (
    <div className="flex items-center justify-center min-h-screen bg-gray-200 p-8">
      <div className="bg-white rounded-lg shadow-lg p-8 max-w-4xl w-full">
        <svg
          id="claim_ico"
          xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
          viewBox="0 0 931.24 799.62"
          className="w-full h-auto"
          dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{ __html: svgContent }}
        />
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}
```

```typescriptreact
'use client';

import { useEffect, useState } from 'react';

export default function ClaimIcon() {
  const [svgContent, setSvgContent] = useState<string>('');
  const [error, setError] = useState<string>('');

  useEffect(() => {
    fetch('/img/claim_ico_.svg')
      .then((res) => {
        if (!res.ok) {
          throw new Error(`Failed to fetch SVG: ${res.status} ${res.statusText}`);
        }
        return res.text();
      })
      .then((text) => {
        // Remove XML declaration and extract just the SVG content
        const svgMatch = text.match(/<svg[^>]*>([\s\S]*)<\/svg>/);
        if (svgMatch) {
          let content = svgMatch[1];
          
          // Remove the defs/style block
          content = content.replace(/<defs>[\s\S]*?<\/defs>/g, '');
          
          // Replace style classes with inline fill attributes using CSS variables
          content = content.replace(
            /class="cls-1"/g,
            'fill="var(--color-black-very-dark)"'
          );
          content = content.replace(
            /class="cls-2"/g,
            'fill="var(--color-gray-dark)"'
          );
          content = content.replace(
            /class="cls-3"/g,
            'fill="var(--color-accent-red)"'
          );
          content = content.replace(
            /class="cls-4"/g,
            'fill="var(--color-gray-medium)"'
          );
          content = content.replace(
            /class="cls-5"/g,
            'fill="var(--color-cream)"'
          );
          content = content.replace(
            /class="cls-6"/g,
            'fill="var(--color-black-darkest)"'
          );
          
          // Remove all cls-* classes from class attributes, keeping other classes
          content = content.replace(
            /class="([^"]*)"/g,
            (match, classes) => {
              const classList = classes.split(/\s+/).filter((cls: string) => cls && !cls.match(/^cls-[0-9]$/));
              return classList.length > 0 ? `class="${classList.join(' ')}"` : '';
            }
          );
          
          // Clean up any empty class attributes
          content = content.replace(/\s+class=""/g, '');
          
          setSvgContent(content);
        } else {
          setError('Could not parse SVG content');
        }
      })
      .catch((err) => {
        console.error('Failed to load SVG:', err);
        setError(err.message || 'Failed to load SVG');
      });
  }, []);
```

Fixing the class replacement logic to preserve other classes:


```typescriptreact
'use client';

import { useEffect, useState } from 'react';

export default function ClaimIcon() {
  const [svgContent, setSvgContent] = useState<string>('');
  const [error, setError] = useState<string>('');

  useEffect(() => {
    fetch('/img/claim_ico_.svg')
      .then((res) => {
        if (!res.ok) {
          throw new Error(`Failed to fetch SVG: ${res.status} ${res.statusText}`);
        }
        return res.text();
      })
      .then((text) => {
        // Remove XML declaration and extract just the SVG content
        const svgMatch = text.match(/<svg[^>]*>([\s\S]*)<\/svg>/);
        if (svgMatch) {
          let content = svgMatch[1];
          
          // Remove the defs/style block
          content = content.replace(/<defs>[\s\S]*?<\/defs>/g, '');
          
          // Replace style classes with inline fill attributes using CSS variables
          // First, add fill attributes for cls-* classes
          content = content.replace(
            /class="cls-1"/g,
            'class="cls-1" fill="var(--color-black-very-dark)"'
          );
          content = content.replace(
            /class="cls-2"/g,
            'class="cls-2" fill="var(--color-gray-dark)"'
          );
          content = content.replace(
            /class="cls-3"/g,
            'class="cls-3" fill="var(--color-accent-red)"'
          );
          content = content.replace(
            /class="cls-4"/g,
            'class="cls-4" fill="var(--color-gray-medium)"'
          );
          content = content.replace(
            /class="cls-5"/g,
            'class="cls-5" fill="var(--color-cream)"'
          );
          content = content.replace(
            /class="cls-6"/g,
            'class="cls-6" fill="var(--color-black-darkest)"'
          );
          
          // Handle cases where cls-* classes are combined with other classes
          content = content.replace(
            /class="([^"]*)\s+cls-1([^"]*)"/g,
            (match, before, after) => {
              return `class="${before}${after}" fill="var(--color-black-very-dark)"`;
            }
          );
          content = content.replace(
            /class="([^"]*)\s+cls-2([^"]*)"/g,
            (match, before, after) => {
              return `class="${before}${after}" fill="var(--color-gray-dark)"`;
            }
          );
          content = content.replace(
            /class="([^"]*)\s+cls-3([^"]*)"/g,
            (match, before, after) => {
              return `class="${before}${after}" fill="var(--color-accent-red)"`;
            }
          );
          content = content.replace(
            /class="([^"]*)\s+cls-4([^"]*)"/g,
            (match, before, after) => {
              return `class="${before}${after}" fill="var(--color-gray-medium)"`;
            }
          );
          content = content.replace(
            /class="([^"]*)\s+cls-5([^"]*)"/g,
            (match, before, after) => {
              return `class="${before}${after}" fill="var(--color-cream)"`;
            }
          );
          content = content.replace(
            /class="([^"]*)\s+cls-6([^"]*)"/g,
            (match, before, after) => {
              return `class="${before}${after}" fill="var(--color-black-darkest)"`;
            }
          );
          
          // Remove all cls-* classes from class attributes, keeping other classes
          content = content.replace(
            /class="([^"]*)"/g,
            (match, classes) => {
              const classList = classes.split(/\s+/).filter((cls: string) => cls && !cls.match(/^cls-[0-9]$/));
              return classList.length > 0 ? `class="${classList.join(' ')}"` : '';
            }
          );
          
          // Clean up any empty class attributes
          content = content.replace(/\s+class=""/g, '');
          
          setSvgContent(content);
        } else {
          setError('Could not parse SVG content');
        }
      })
      .catch((err) => {
        console.error('Failed to load SVG:', err);
        setError(err.message || 'Failed to load SVG');
      });
  }, []);

  if (error) {
    return (
      <div className="flex items-center justify-center min-h-screen bg-gray-200 p-8">
        <div className="bg-white rounded-lg shadow-lg p-8 max-w-4xl w-full text-center">
          <p className="text-red-600">Error: {error}</p>
        </div>
      </div>
    );
  }

  if (!svgContent) {
    return (
      <div className="flex items-center justify-center min-h-screen bg-gray-200 p-8">
        <div className="bg-white rounded-lg shadow-lg p-8 max-w-4xl w-full text-center">
          <p>Loading...</p>
        </div>
      </div>
    );
  }

  return (
    <div className="flex items-center justify-center min-h-screen bg-gray-200 p-8">
      <div className="bg-white rounded-lg shadow-lg p-8 max-w-4xl w-full">
        <svg
          id="claim_ico"
          xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
          viewBox="0 0 931.24 799.62"
          className="w-full h-auto"
          dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{ __html: svgContent }}
        />
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}
```

Updating the anim page to embed the SVG using `dangerouslySetInnerHTML`. Since the SVG is large, creating a client component that loads and embeds it:


```typescriptreact
'use client';

import { useEffect, useState } from 'react';

export default function AnimPage() {
  const [svgContent, setSvgContent] = useState<string>('');

  useEffect(() => {
    fetch('/img/claim_ico_.svg')
      .then((res) => res.text())
      .then((text) => {
        // Process the SVG to convert it to JSX-compatible format
        let processed = text;
        
        // Remove XML declaration
        processed = processed.replace(/<\?xml[^>]*\?>/g, '');
        
        // Replace class with className
        processed = processed.replace(/\bclass=/g, 'className=');
        
        // Replace data-name with dataName
        processed = processed.replace(/\bdata-name=/g, 'dataName=');
        
        // Replace fill-rule with fillRule
        processed = processed.replace(/\bfill-rule=/g, 'fillRule=');
        
        // Replace stroke-width with strokeWidth
        processed = processed.replace(/\bstroke-width=/g, 'strokeWidth=');
        
        // Replace stroke-miterlimit with strokeMiterlimit
        processed = processed.replace(/\bstroke-miterlimit=/g, 'strokeMiterlimit=');
        
        // Remove defs block
        processed = processed.replace(/<defs>[\s\S]*?<\/defs>/g, '');
        
        // Replace cls-* classes with CSS variables
        processed = processed.replace(/className="cls-1"/g, 'fill="var(--color-black-very-dark)"');
        processed = processed.replace(/className="cls-2"/g, 'fill="var(--color-gray-dark)"');
        processed = processed.replace(/className="cls-3"/g, 'fill="var(--color-accent-red)"');
        processed = processed.replace(/className="cls-4"/g, 'fill="var(--color-gray-medium)"');
        processed = processed.replace(/className="cls-5"/g, 'fill="var(--color-cream)"');
        processed = processed.replace(/className="cls-6"/g, 'fill="var(--color-black-darkest)"');
        
        // Add fill to circle element if it doesn't have one
        processed = processed.replace(
          /<circle id="bg_badge_ico"([^>]*)>/,
          '<circle id="bg_badge_ico"$1 fill="var(--color-cream)">'
        );
        
        // Remove cls-* from className attributes
        processed = processed.replace(
          /className="([^"]*)"/g,
          (match, classes) => {
            const classList = classes.split(/\s+/).filter((cls: string) => cls && !cls.match(/^cls-[0-9]$/));
            return classList.length > 0 ? `className="${classList.join(' ')}"` : '';
          }
        );
        
        // Clean up empty className attributes
        processed = processed.replace(/\s+className=""/g, '');
        
        setSvgContent(processed);
      })
      .catch((err) => {
        console.error('Failed to load SVG:', err);
      });
  }, []);

  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen bg-gray-100 p-8 flex items-center justify-center">
      <div className="max-w-4xl w-full flex justify-center">
        {svgContent && (
          <div
            className="w-full h-auto"
            dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{ __html: svgContent }}
          />
        )}
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}


```

3. Removes the `<defs>` block and replaces color classes with CSS variables
4. Embeds it using `dangerouslySetInnerHTML`

```typescriptreact
'use client';

import { useEffect, useState } from 'react';

export default function AnimPage() {
  const [svgContent, setSvgContent] = useState<string>('');
  const [error, setError] = useState<string>('');

  useEffect(() => {
    fetch('/img/claim_ico_.svg')
      .then((res) => {
        if (!res.ok) {
          throw new Error(`Failed to fetch SVG: ${res.status} ${res.statusText}`);
        }
        return res.text();
      })
      .then((text) => {
        // Process the SVG to convert it to JSX-compatible format
        let processed = text;
        
        // Remove XML declaration
        processed = processed.replace(/<\?xml[^>]*\?>/g, '');
        
        // Remove defs block first (before converting class to className)
        processed = processed.replace(/<defs>[\s\S]*?<\/defs>/g, '');
        
        // Replace class with className (but only for actual class attributes, not in strings)
        processed = processed.replace(/\bclass="([^"]*)"/g, 'className="$1"');
        
        // Replace data-name with dataName
        processed = processed.replace(/\bdata-name=/g, 'dataName=');
        
        // Replace fill-rule with fillRule
        processed = processed.replace(/\bfill-rule=/g, 'fillRule=');
        
        // Replace stroke-width with strokeWidth
        processed = processed.replace(/\bstroke-width=/g, 'strokeWidth=');
        
        // Replace stroke-miterlimit with strokeMiterlimit
        processed = processed.replace(/\bstroke-miterlimit=/g, 'strokeMiterlimit=');
        
        // Add fill attributes based on cls-* classes BEFORE removing them
        processed = processed.replace(/className="cls-1"/g, 'fill="var(--color-black-very-dark)" className="cls-1"');
        processed = processed.replace(/className="cls-2"/g, 'fill="var(--color-gray-dark)" className="cls-2"');
        processed = processed.replace(/className="cls-3"/g, 'fill="var(--color-accent-red)" className="cls-3"');
        processed = processed.replace(/className="cls-4"/g, 'fill="var(--color-gray-medium)" className="cls-4"');
        processed = processed.replace(/className="cls-5"/g, 'fill="var(--color-cream)" className="cls-5"');
        processed = processed.replace(/className="cls-6"/g, 'fill="var(--color-black-darkest)" className="cls-6"');
        
        // Add fill to circle element if it doesn't have one
        if (!processed.includes('id="bg_badge_ico"') || !processed.match(/id="bg_badge_ico"[^>]*fill=/)) {
          processed = processed.replace(
            /<circle id="bg_badge_ico"([^>]*)>/,
            '<circle id="bg_badge_ico"$1 fill="var(--color-cream)">'
          );
        }
        
        // Remove cls-* from className attributes
        processed = processed.replace(
          /className="([^"]*)"/g,
          (match, classes) => {
            const classList = classes.split(/\s+/).filter((cls: string) => cls && !cls.match(/^cls-[0-9]$/));
            return classList.length > 0 ? `className="${classList.join(' ')}"` : '';
          }
        );
        
        // Clean up empty className attributes
        processed = processed.replace(/\s+className=""/g, '');
        
        // Trim whitespace
        processed = processed.trim();
        
        console.log('SVG processed, length:', processed.length);
        setSvgContent(processed);
      })
      .catch((err) => {
        console.error('Failed to load SVG:', err);
        setError(err instanceof Error ? err.message : 'Failed to load SVG');
      });
  }, []);

  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen bg-gray-100 p-8 flex items-center justify-center">
      <div className="max-w-4xl w-full flex justify-center">
        {error && (
          <div className="text-red-500">Error: {error}</div>
        )}
        {!error && !svgContent && (
          <div className="text-gray-500">Loading SVG...</div>
        )}
        {svgContent && (
          <div
            className="w-full h-auto"
            dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{ __html: svgContent }}
          />
        )}
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}
```

```typescriptreact
export default function LogoDisplay() {

          // Remove the defs/style block

          // Replace style classes with inline fill/stroke attributes using CSS variables
          // cls-1 -> fill: var(--color-black-very-dark)
          iconContent = iconContent.replace(
            /class="cls-1"/g,
            'class="cls-1" fill="var(--color-black-very-dark)"'
          );
          // cls-2 -> fill: var(--color-gray-dark)
          iconContent = iconContent.replace(
            /class="cls-2"/g,
            'class="cls-2" fill="var(--color-gray-dark)"'
          );
          // cls-3 -> fill: var(--color-accent-red)
          iconContent = iconContent.replace(
            /class="cls-3"/g,
            'class="cls-3" fill="var(--color-accent-red)"'
          );
          // cls-4 -> fill: var(--color-gray-medium)
          iconContent = iconContent.replace(
            /class="cls-4"/g,
            'class="cls-4" fill="var(--color-gray-medium)"'
          );
          // cls-5 -> fill: var(--color-cream)
          iconContent = iconContent.replace(

          // cls-6 -> fill: var(--color-black-darkest)
          iconContent = iconContent.replace(

            'class="cls-6" fill="var(--color-black-darkest)"'
          );
          
          // Remove all style classes (cls-1 through cls-6) from class attributes, keeping other classes
          iconContent = iconContent.replace(
            /class="([^"]*)"/g,
            (match, classes) => {
              const classList = classes.split(/\s+/).filter((cls: string) => cls && !cls.match(/^cls-[1-6]$/));
              return classList.length > 0 ? `class="${classList.join(' ')}"` : '';

          );
          
          // Clean up any empty class attributes
          iconContent = iconContent.replace(/\s+class=""/g, '');

        // Process the main logo SVG
        const svgMatch = logoText.match(/<svg[^>]*>([\s\S]*)<\/svg>/);
        if (svgMatch) {

          content = content.replace(

          // st1 -> fill: var(--color-gray-dark)
          content = content.replace(

          // st2 -> fill: var(--color-white), fillRule: evenodd
          content = content.replace(

          );
          // st3 -> fill: var(--color-dark)
          content = content.replace(
```
