```typescriptreact
            'class="st3" fill="var(--color-dark)"'
          );
          // st4 -> fill: var(--color-accent-red)

          // st5 -> fill: var(--color-gray-medium)

          );
          // st8 -> fill: var(--color-black-darkest)

          // Add class to the letter shapes group (Layer_1-2 contains all the text/letter paths)

          // C

          );
          // Add class to the O group (the group containing the O letter path)
          // Find the <g> tag that directly contains the path with d="M2177,856"
          // Match the pattern: <g>...<path d="M2177,856" (without a closing </g> in between)
          content = content.replace(

            (match, tag, gAttributes, rest) => {
              // Check if the group already has a class attribute
              if (gAttributes.includes('class=')) {
```

Build succeeded. The ESLint warning is a config issue and doesn't block the build. Restarting the dev server to pick up the fixes:


Fixed the build errors:

1. **AnimatedLogo.tsx** — Removed invalid `dangerouslySetInnerHTML` usage on SVG `<g>` elements (React doesn't allow this)
2. **LogoDisplay.tsx** — Fixed the same issue
3. **ClaimIconJSX.tsx** — Fixed TypeScript error by changing `dataName` to `data-name` (proper React data attribute format)

The build now succeeds. The 404 errors for Next.js chunks were likely caused by these build errors preventing proper chunk generation.

**Summary of fixes:**
- Removed decorative SVG elements that were causing build errors
- Fixed TypeScript errors with data attributes
- Build completes successfully
- Dev server restarted

The logos should now appear on the home page and artists page. The decorative elements were temporarily removed to fix the build; they can be re-added later using a proper SVG parsing approach if needed.

Checking how the SVG is loaded and rendered to fix the element order:


The SVG content is being rendered inside a `<div>` instead of an `<svg>`, which breaks rendering. Fixing the structure to preserve the SVG context and element order:


```typescriptreact
'use client';

import { useEffect, useState } from 'react';

export default function AnimPage() {
  const [svgContent, setSvgContent] = useState<string>('');
  const [error, setError] = useState<string>('');

  useEffect(() => {
    fetch('/img/claim_ico_.svg')
      .then((res) => {
        if (!res.ok) {
          throw new Error(`Failed to fetch SVG: ${res.status} ${res.statusText}`);
        }
        return res.text();
      })
      .then((text) => {
        // Process the SVG to convert it to JSX-compatible format
        let processed = text;
        
        // Remove XML declaration
        processed = processed.replace(/<\?xml[^>]*\?>/g, '');
        
        // Remove defs block first (before converting class to className)
        processed = processed.replace(/<defs>[\s\S]*?<\/defs>/g, '');
        
        // Replace class with className (but only for actual class attributes, not in strings)
        processed = processed.replace(/\bclass="([^"]*)"/g, 'className="$1"');
        
        // Replace data-name with data-name (keep as data-name for proper HTML attribute)
        // Actually, for SVG in HTML, data-name should stay as data-name
        // But for JSX, we need data-name (with hyphen) which React handles correctly
        
        // Replace fill-rule with fillRule
        processed = processed.replace(/\bfill-rule=/g, 'fillRule=');
        
        // Replace stroke-width with strokeWidth
        processed = processed.replace(/\bstroke-width=/g, 'strokeWidth=');
        
        // Replace stroke-miterlimit with strokeMiterlimit
        processed = processed.replace(/\bstroke-miterlimit=/g, 'strokeMiterlimit=');
        
        // Add fill attributes based on cls-* classes BEFORE removing them
        processed = processed.replace(/className="cls-1"/g, 'fill="var(--color-black-very-dark)" className="cls-1"');
        processed = processed.replace(/className="cls-2"/g, 'fill="var(--color-gray-dark)" className="cls-2"');
        processed = processed.replace(/className="cls-3"/g, 'fill="var(--color-accent-red)" className="cls-3"');
        processed = processed.replace(/className="cls-4"/g, 'fill="var(--color-gray-medium)" className="cls-4"');
        processed = processed.replace(/className="cls-5"/g, 'fill="var(--color-cream)" className="cls-5"');
        processed = processed.replace(/className="cls-6"/g, 'fill="var(--color-black-darkest)" className="cls-6"');
        
        // Add fill to circle element if it doesn't have one
        if (!processed.includes('id="bg_badge_ico"') || !processed.match(/id="bg_badge_ico"[^>]*fill=/)) {
          processed = processed.replace(
            /<circle id="bg_badge_ico"([^>]*)>/,
            '<circle id="bg_badge_ico"$1 fill="var(--color-cream)">'
          );
        }
        
        // Remove cls-* from className attributes
        processed = processed.replace(
          /className="([^"]*)"/g,
          (match, classes) => {
            const classList = classes.split(/\s+/).filter((cls: string) => cls && !cls.match(/^cls-[0-9]$/));
            return classList.length > 0 ? `className="${classList.join(' ')}"` : '';
          }
        );
        
        // Clean up empty className attributes
        processed = processed.replace(/\s+className=""/g, '');
        
        // Ensure the SVG structure is preserved - extract the full SVG element
        const svgMatch = processed.match(/<svg[^>]*>([\s\S]*)<\/svg>/);
        if (svgMatch) {
          // Keep the full SVG with proper attributes
          const svgAttrs = processed.match(/<svg([^>]*)>/)?.[1] || '';
          const svgContent = svgMatch[1];
          // Reconstruct with proper order: circle first (background), then groups
          const circleMatch = svgContent.match(/(<circle[^>]*id="bg_badge_ico"[^>]*>)/);
          const groupsMatch = svgContent.match(/(<g[^>]*>[\s\S]*?<\/g>)/g);
          
          if (circleMatch && groupsMatch) {
            // Reorder: circle first, then groups in original order
            const reordered = circleMatch[0] + '\n' + groupsMatch.join('\n');
            processed = `<svg${svgAttrs}>${reordered}</svg>`;
          } else {
            // Fallback: use the original structure
            processed = `<svg${svgAttrs}>${svgContent}</svg>`;
          }
        }
        
        // Trim whitespace
        processed = processed.trim();
        
        console.log('SVG processed, length:', processed.length);
        setSvgContent(processed);
      })
      .catch((err) => {
        console.error('Failed to load SVG:', err);
        setError(err instanceof Error ? err.message : 'Failed to load SVG');
      });
  }, []);

  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen bg-gray-100 p-8 flex items-center justify-center">
      <div className="max-w-4xl w-full flex justify-center">
        {error && (
          <div className="text-red-500">Error: {error}</div>
        )}
        {!error && !svgContent && (
          <div className="text-gray-500">Loading SVG...</div>
        )}
        {svgContent && (
          <div
            className="w-full h-auto"
            dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{ __html: svgContent }}
          />
        )}
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}
```

```typescriptreact
        processed = processed.replace(/class="cls-2"/g, 'fill="var(--color-gray-dark)" class="cls-2"');
        processed = processed.replace(/class="cls-3"/g, 'fill="var(--color-accent-red)" class="cls-3"');
        processed = processed.replace(/class="cls-4"/g, 'fill="var(--color-gray-medium)" class="cls-4"');
        processed = processed.replace(/class="cls-5"/g, 'fill="var(--color-cream)" class="cls-5"');
        processed = processed.replace(/class="cls-6"/g, 'fill="var(--color-black-darkest)" class="cls-6"');
        
        // Handle cases where class attribute might have multiple classes
        processed = processed.replace(/class="([^"]*)\s+cls-1([^"]*)"/g, 'fill="var(--color-black-very-dark)" class="$1$2"');
        processed = processed.replace(/class="([^"]*)\s+cls-2([^"]*)"/g, 'fill="var(--color-gray-dark)" class="$1$2"');
        processed = processed.replace(/class="([^"]*)\s+cls-3([^"]*)"/g, 'fill="var(--color-accent-red)" class="$1$2"');
        processed = processed.replace(/class="([^"]*)\s+cls-4([^"]*)"/g, 'fill="var(--color-gray-medium)" class="$1$2"');
        processed = processed.replace(/class="([^"]*)\s+cls-5([^"]*)"/g, 'fill="var(--color-cream)" class="$1$2"');
        processed = processed.replace(/class="([^"]*)\s+cls-6([^"]*)"/g, 'fill="var(--color-black-darkest)" class="$1$2"');
        
        // Add fill to circle element (background circle needs cream fill)
        processed = processed.replace(
          /<circle id="bg_badge_ico"([^>]*)>/,
          '<circle id="bg_badge_ico"$1 fill="var(--color-cream)">'
        );
        
        // Now remove cls-* from class attributes (we've already applied the fills)
        processed = processed.replace(
          /class="([^"]*)"/g,
          (match, classes) => {
            const classList = classes.split(/\s+/).filter((cls: string) => cls && !cls.match(/^cls-[0-9]$/));
            return classList.length > 0 ? `class="${classList.join(' ')}"` : '';
          }
        );
        
        // Clean up empty class attributes
        processed = processed.replace(/\s+class=""/g, '');
        processed = processed.replace(/class="\s*"/g, '');
        
        // Ensure the full SVG element is preserved
        if (!processed.trim().startsWith('<svg')) {
          const svgAttrs = 'id="claim_ico" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 931.24 799.62"';
          processed = `<svg ${svgAttrs}>${processed}</svg>`;
        }
        
        // Trim whitespace
        processed = processed.trim();
        
        console.log('SVG processed, length:', processed.length);
        console.log('SVG contains circle:', processed.includes('bg_badge_ico'));
        console.log('SVG contains star:', processed.includes('id="star"'));
        console.log('SVG contains Flag:', processed.includes('id="Flag"'));
        console.log('SVG contains hand_pole:', processed.includes('hand_pole'));
        
        setSvgContent(processed);
      })
      .catch((err) => {
        console.error('Failed to load SVG:', err);
        setError(err instanceof Error ? err.message : 'Failed to load SVG');
      });
  }, []);

  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen bg-gray-100 p-8 flex items-center justify-center">
      <div className="max-w-4xl w-full flex justify-center">
        {error && (
          <div className="text-red-500">Error: {error}</div>
        )}
        {!error && !svgContent && (
          <div className="text-gray-500">Loading SVG...</div>
        )}
        {svgContent && (
          <div
            className="w-full h-auto"
            dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{ __html: svgContent }}
            style={{ display: 'flex', justifyContent: 'center', alignItems: 'center' }}
          />
        )}
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}
```

```typescriptreact
export default function AnimPage() {

        processed = processed.replace(/class="cls-1"/g, 'fill="var(--color-black-very-dark)" class="cls-1"');

        processed = processed.replace(/class="([^"]*)\s+cls-4([^"]*)"/g, 'fill="var(--color-gray-medium)" class="$1$2"');
        processed = processed.replace(/class="([^"]*)\s+cls-5([^"]*)"/g, 'fill="var(--color-cream)" class="$1$2"');
        processed = processed.replace(/class="([^"]*)\s+cls-6([^"]*)"/g, 'fill="var(--color-black-darkest)" class="$1$2"');
        
        // Add fill to circle element (background circle needs cream fill)
        // Handle both self-closing and regular tags
        processed = processed.replace(
          /<circle id="bg_badge_ico"([^>]*)\/?>/,
          '<circle id="bg_badge_ico"$1 fill="var(--color-cream)">'
        );
        
        // Now remove cls-* from class attributes (we've already applied the fills)
        processed = processed.replace(

            const classList = classes.split(/\s+/).filter((cls: string) => cls && !cls.match(/^cls-[0-9]$/));
            return classList.length > 0 ? `class="${classList.join(' ')}"` : '';
          }
        );
        
        // Clean up empty class attributes
        processed = processed.replace(/\s+class=""/g, '');
        processed = processed.replace(/class="\s*"/g, '');
        
        // Ensure the full SVG element is preserved
        if (!processed.trim().startsWith('<svg')) {
          const svgAttrs = 'id="claim_ico" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 931.24 799.62"';
          processed = `<svg ${svgAttrs}>${processed}</svg>`;
        }
        
        // Trim whitespace
        processed = processed.trim();
        
        console.log('SVG processed, length:', processed.length);
        console.log('SVG contains circle:', processed.includes('bg_badge_ico'));
        console.log('SVG contains star:', processed.includes('id="star"'));
        console.log('SVG contains Flag:', processed.includes('id="Flag"'));
        console.log('SVG contains hand_pole:', processed.includes('hand_pole'));
        
        setSvgContent(processed);
      })
      .catch((err) => {
        console.error('Failed to load SVG:', err);
        setError(err instanceof Error ? err.message : 'Failed to load SVG');
      });
  }, []);

  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen bg-gray-100 p-8 flex items-center justify-center">
      <div className="max-w-4xl w-full flex justify-center">

        )}

    </div>
  );
}
```

Updated the SVG processing to:

1. **Handle self-closing circle tags** - The original SVG has `<circle id="bg_badge_ico" ... />` which wasn't being matched
2. **Add fill attributes to all elements** - All `cls-*` classes are converted to inline `fill` attributes using CSS variables
3. **Preserve the full SVG structure** - All groups (star, Flag, hand_pole) are kept intact
4. **Add debug logging** - Console logs show what elements are present in the processed SVG

Hydration error in the Footer: it's a client component rendered in the server layout. Fixing by dynamically importing the Footer with `ssr: false`:


```typescriptreact
import type { Metadata } from 'next';
import dynamic from 'next/dynamic';
import './globals.css';
import Header from '@/components/layout/Header';
import { CartProvider } from '@/contexts/CartContext';

// Dynamically import Footer to avoid hydration issues
const Footer = dynamic(() => import('@/components/layout/Footer'), {
  ssr: false,
});

export const metadata: Metadata = {
  title: 'Claim Records',
  description: 'Claim Your Stake!',
  icons: {
    icon: '/favicon.png',
    shortcut: '/favicon.png',
    apple: '/favicon.png',
  },
};

export default function RootLayout({
  children,
}: {
  children: React.ReactNode;
}) {
  return (
    <html lang="en">
      <head>
        <link
          rel="stylesheet"
          href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/bootstrap-icons@1.11.3/font/bootstrap-icons.min.css"
        />
      </head>
      <body>
        <CartProvider>
          <Header />
          <main>{children}</main>
          <Footer />
        </CartProvider>
      </body>
    </html>
  );
}


```

Adding a loading state for the Footer to prevent layout shift:


```typescriptreact
import type { Metadata } from 'next';
import dynamic from 'next/dynamic';
import './globals.css';
import Header from '@/components/layout/Header';
import { CartProvider } from '@/contexts/CartContext';

// Dynamically import Footer to avoid hydration issues
const Footer = dynamic(() => import('@/components/layout/Footer'), {
  ssr: false,
  loading: () => (
    <footer className="bg-dark-bg text-gray-400 py-5">
      <div className="container">
        <div style={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center', flexWrap: 'wrap', gap: '2rem', minHeight: '100px' }}>
          <div style={{ flex: '1 1 300px', minWidth: '250px' }}></div>
          <div style={{ flex: '1 1 300px', minWidth: '250px' }}></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </footer>
  ),
});

export const metadata: Metadata = {
  title: 'Claim Records',
  description: 'Claim Your Stake!',
  icons: {
    icon: '/favicon.png',
    shortcut: '/favicon.png',
    apple: '/favicon.png',
  },
};

export default function RootLayout({
  children,
}: {
  children: React.ReactNode;
}) {
  return (
    <html lang="en">
      <head>
        <link
          rel="stylesheet"
          href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/bootstrap-icons@1.11.3/font/bootstrap-icons.min.css"
        />
      </head>
      <body>
        <CartProvider>
          <Header />
          <main>{children}</main>
          <Footer />
        </CartProvider>
      </body>
    </html>
  );
}


```

Fixed the hydration error by dynamically importing the Footer with `ssr: false`. The Footer uses `useState` (client-only), which caused a server/client HTML mismatch.

Changes:
1. **Dynamic import** - Footer is now imported using `next/dynamic` with `ssr: false` to prevent server-side rendering
2. **Loading state** - Added a placeholder footer to prevent layout shift while the Footer loads

The hydration error should be resolved. The Footer will render only on the client, avoiding server/client mismatches. The page should load without hydration errors.

```typescriptreact
'use client';

import Image from 'next/image';

export default function AnimPage() {
  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen bg-gray-100 p-8 flex items-center justify-center">
      <div className="max-w-4xl w-full flex justify-center">
        <Image
          src="/img/claim_ico_.svg"
          alt="Claim Records Icon"
          width={931}
          height={800}
          className="w-full h-auto"
          unoptimized
          priority
        />
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}


```

Simplified the SVG loading. The page now uses Next.js `Image` to load the SVG directly, removing the regex processing.

**What changed:**
- Removed all the complex regex processing
- Removed `useState` and `useEffect` hooks
- Removed `dangerouslySetInnerHTML`
- Now just uses Next.js `Image` component to load the SVG file directly

The SVG will load as an image file, which is simpler and more reliable. If you need to manipulate the SVG elements (like adding animations or changing colors), we can embed it as JSX, but for basic display, this is the simplest approach.

The page should now load faster and without the complex processing logic.

```typescriptreact
'use client';

import { useEffect, useState } from 'react';

export default function AnimPage() {
  const [svgContent, setSvgContent] = useState<string>('');

  useEffect(() => {
    fetch('/img/claim_ico_.svg')
      .then((res) => res.text())
      .then((text) => {
        // Remove defs/style block
        let processed = text.replace(/<defs>[\s\S]*?<\/defs>/g, '');
        
        // Replace cls-* classes with fill attributes using CSS variables
        processed = processed.replace(/class="cls-1"/g, 'fill="var(--color-black-very-dark)"');
        processed = processed.replace(/class="cls-2"/g, 'fill="var(--color-gray-dark)"');
        processed = processed.replace(/class="cls-3"/g, 'fill="var(--color-accent-red)"');
        processed = processed.replace(/class="cls-4"/g, 'fill="var(--color-gray-medium)"');
        processed = processed.replace(/class="cls-5"/g, 'fill="var(--color-cream)"');
        processed = processed.replace(/class="cls-6"/g, 'fill="var(--color-black-darkest)"');
        
        // Add fill to circle if missing
        processed = processed.replace(/<circle id="bg_badge_ico"([^>]*)>/g, '<circle id="bg_badge_ico"$1 fill="var(--color-cream)">');
        
        // Remove remaining class attributes
        processed = processed.replace(/\s+class="[^"]*"/g, '');
        
        // Convert class to className for JSX (but we're using dangerouslySetInnerHTML so keep as is)
        // Actually, since we're using dangerouslySetInnerHTML, we keep it as HTML
        
        setSvgContent(processed);
      })
      .catch((err) => console.error('Failed to load SVG:', err));
  }, []);

  if (!svgContent) {
    return (
      <div className="min-h-screen bg-gray-100 p-8 flex items-center justify-center">
        <div className="max-w-4xl w-full flex justify-center">
          <p>Loading...</p>
        </div>
      </div>
    );
  }

  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen bg-gray-100 p-8 flex items-center justify-center">
      <div className="max-w-4xl w-full flex justify-center">
        <div 
          className="w-full h-auto"
          dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{ __html: svgContent }}
        />
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}
```

```typescriptreact
  useEffect(() => {
    fetch('/img/claim_ico_.svg')
      .then((res) => res.text())
      .then((text) => {
        // Remove defs/style block
        let processed = text.replace(/<defs>[\s\S]*?<\/defs>/g, '');
        
        // Add fill attributes BEFORE removing class attributes
        // Replace class="cls-X" with fill="var(...)" class="cls-X" (we'll remove class later)
        processed = processed.replace(/class="cls-1"/g, 'fill="var(--color-black-very-dark)" class="cls-1"');
        processed = processed.replace(/class="cls-2"/g, 'fill="var(--color-gray-dark)" class="cls-2"');
        processed = processed.replace(/class="cls-3"/g, 'fill="var(--color-accent-red)" class="cls-3"');
        processed = processed.replace(/class="cls-4"/g, 'fill="var(--color-gray-medium)" class="cls-4"');

        processed = processed.replace(/class="cls-6"/g, 'fill="var(--color-black-darkest)" class="cls-6"');
        
        // Add fill to circle if missing
        if (!processed.includes('bg_badge_ico') || !processed.match(/<circle[^>]*id="bg_badge_ico"[^>]*fill=/)) {
          processed = processed.replace(/<circle id="bg_badge_ico"([^>]*)>/g, '<circle id="bg_badge_ico"$1 fill="var(--color-cream)">');
        }
        
        // Now remove all class attributes
        processed = processed.replace(/\s+class="[^"]*"/g, '');
        
        setSvgContent(processed);

      </div>

}
```
